DataElement.preferredName: Dental Oral Cavity Clinical Abnormality Detection Yes No Clinical Abnormality Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to signify whether clinical abnormalities are detected in the mouth on probing during an oral examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state._Detected; perceived or discerned.
